intro: Cerochlamys purpureostyla, commonly known as the purple-styled cerochlamys, is a rare and striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that display a vibrant mix of purple and pink hues. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
